dt: {bc}to move or climb hastily especially on all fours
{bc}to struggle eagerly or unceremoniously for possession of something
{bc}to get or gather something with difficulty or in irregular ways
{bc}to take off quickly in response to an alert
{bc}to run with the ball after the pass protection breaks down

dt.t: {wi}scramble{/wi} up a dinner for unexpected guests

dt: {bc}to toss or mix together in confusion {bc}to throw into disorder {bc}{sx|jumble||}

dt.t: Bad weather often {wi}scrambles{/wi} the train schedules.

dt: {bc}to cause or order (interceptor fighter aircraft) to take off quickly

dt.t: Keating said he ordered the fighters to be {wi}scrambled{/wi} immediately after seeing information about the crash on television.

dt: {bc}to disarrange the elements of a transmission (such as a telephone or television signal) in order to make unintelligible to interception

shortdef: to move with urgency or panic
to move or climb hastily especially on all fours
to struggle eagerly or unceremoniously for possession of something

dt: {bc}the act or an instance of {d_link|scrambling|scramble:1}: such as
{bc}the act of moving or climbing over something quickly especially on all fours
{bc}an eager and unceremonious or unscrupulous struggle
{bc}a rapid emergency takeoff of interceptor fighter aircraft
{bc}a play in which the quarterback runs with the ball while being chased by defensive players after the pass protection breaks down

{bc}a team competition in which all the members of a team tee off on each hole, one of the tee shots is selected, all members hit shots from the position of the selected shot, one shot is again selected, and the process is continued until the hole is completed

dt.t: Sawgrass seemed a far cry from the first competitive golf event I ever played in, a weekend {wi}scramble{/wi} at my local club.

shortdef: the act or an instance of scrambling: such as
the act of moving or climbing over something quickly especially on all fours
a jostling and pushing for possession
